Name: Zanshin
Description:
Zanshin is a fast-paced bluff-based game about samurai fencing inspired by kendo and "Book of Five Rings". This game is my attempt to focus gameplay on "learn your opponent" rather than "learn in-game tactics".
Each player has same hand of skill, bluff and attack cards and five random Strike cards. Each round player try to spend less skill cards than his opponent in order to get advantage or catch an opponent on opposite strike. Players play their skill and bluff cards face down to form their intention for current round, than reacts on opponent's strikes and than ether evade or counterattack.
Three player variant Twofaced Dragon allows player to recreate 2vs1 fight. This variant keeps almost all mechanic from main rules and all players starts with same sets of cards, so wining this fight is very thought challenge for Dragon. I tired to make this variant as close to real situations in kenjutsu as possible. There is no artificial benefits or constrains and every mechanic change justified by real aspect of that kind of fights.

Name: Picture Hunt (Commencing Letters; All "D's")
Description:
Party game. Up to 12 guests are given the same picture and it is suggested that they might try to find up to 60 objects in the picture that begin with a D. The one who makes the longest list (of correct answers, of course) wins.

Universal Publications Ltd. (U.P.L) published a series of games from London during the 1930s to the late 1950s. Special arrangements were made with manufacturers overseas to produce the popular UPL games. The Australian company G.N. Raymond was one company that was granted permission to produce UPL games.

Name: Puzzles in Pictures
Description: Party game. 15 pictures (all different) are placed round the room before the party starts. When guests arrive, they are encouraged to look at the pictures at some time during the party. The picture should suggest a well-known item to them. The one who gets the most right answers after an agreed time, wins.

Name: Flash
Description:
Party game for up to 20 players. They have to then complete their telegram.
Cards are scattered round the room where most guests will congregate. Each player gets a different Number 1 card. On the bottom right corner there will be another word and that is the next card they must find. And so on until they have found the 12 words that complete their telegram. The first to do so, wins.

Name: Icebreakers
Description:
Party game for up to 52 guests.
On arrival, guests are given a card that will tell them their personality for the evening. They are then told to circulate and whilst talking to people, they can ask if they are a certain personality. If the answer is no, then nothing happens, but if the answer is yes, then the person you asked will tell you of the next personality you need to find.
First to collect all 8 personalities wins.

Name: Battlefield Blast
Description: Maneuver your kings and knights to the castle wall, but watch out as your opponent uses air blasters to knock your players off the board. The first player to get two of their pieces to the castle wall is the winner. Kings and knights can only move in a certain direction, so be sure to strategize before moving so as not to wander too close to your opponents air catapault.

Name: Thunderstone: Vision Promo
Description:
German promo-card "Die Vision" / "The Vision"

Text in german from the card:
Kultist - Humanoid

Kampf: Die Vision erhält Lebenspunkte +2 für jeden ausgelegten Helden.
Kampf: Zerstöre 1 Karte mit Lichtbonus.

The English version (included in the first Promo Pack): "The Vision"

Cultist - Humanoid

BATTLE: The Vision gains +2 Health for each revealed Hero.
BATTLE: Destroy one card with a light value.

Name: Les càcous de Marseille
Description:
Les càcous de Marseille is a french roll & move game around the town of Marseille (a high place of regional specificities) it's culture and history in the humorous way.

Players move on the board then answer questions and make imitations to move ahead.
the subjects are the town, the language, the history and the soccer club (of course !)

Player who first arrives in the Vélodrome stadium win the game.

Name: Seven Weeks
Description:
Designers Note:

Have found a potentially interested publisher, and several changes to the design have been made. I'm very pleased with them, but this may mean that the description here will change. - Alex

SEVEN WEEKS is a 2 to 3 player Euro-style war game that aims to recreate the maneuvering, bloodshed, and events of the Austro-Prussian War of 1866 in the German and Bohemian theaters. (The Italian front is also represented as an influence upon forces available and overall morale.)

Players represent the Prussians and their North German allies, the Bavarian and Federal German forces (including Baden, Hesse Darmstadt, Nassau, and Wurttemburg amongst others) , and the Habsburgs (who also control the Saxons, Hanoverians, and Kurhessen/Hesse-Kassel forces). The Bavarian and Habsburg forces must work together to stop the Prussians from achieving the historical victory - a crushing blow for the Habsburgs, a defeat for independent states in Germany, and the beginning of a long era of Prussian hegemony over German affairs.

The game utilizes hand management and card driven mechanics. The map is a traditional hex map, depicting major population centers, fortresses, and rail lines. The combat system uses a system of "tactical cards" and battlefield deployment, implementing some fresh ideas intended to represent the player's role as the commander in chief of a military establishment and the necessity of relying upon the battlefield doctrine practiced by his/her forces. Prussian forces, for example, heavily rely upon open order formation and "Schnellfeuer" technique, while the Habsburgs are fond of the "Stosstaktik" approach and rely upon a superior artillery arm. The game is completely diceless.

The aim is to produce an exciting wargame that can easily be played within two hours. The game is currently in playtesting, and hoping for a "Sooner than Later" publication date as we look for a publisher.

Name: Good Help: Evil Doctors and an Angry Mob
Description: In Evil Doctors and an Angry Mob, an expansion for Good Help, evil doctors get special abilities and several townspeople are added to the action card deck. Once a monster roams the board, the townspeople become a mob and can confront and fight monsters. If you can control the mob, you can control the endgame!

Name: Space Pirate
Description:
Each player starts with 25 "ovni's" in his own color, 4 blue "ovni's" and 1 white "ovni".

The players take turns placing "ovni's", which are gears, on the board, thus creating a chain of gears. The gears must placed so that the gears can still turn.

A player can block an opponent's chain by placing a pirate (blue "ovni") at the end of his chain.

The player that can make the opponent's gear turn wins.

Name: Jack-the-Lad
Description:
A game of wheeling 'n' dealing - ducking 'n' diving - making or breaking!

Players move their character around the board, buying and gambling until there is only one player left with any money.

This is a roll-and-move game, where each space is either a gamble for gain or a penalty space.

Name: Lerne München kennen
Description:
This is a trivia game about the German city of Munich.

Players roll a die, move around the trails on the board across Munich (a satelite photo) and answer questions about the state. The first one to make it back to the starting space after collecting 8 cards from the different Bavarian regions and answering a final question correctly wins.
Families: Series: Lerne ... kennen (Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche München)

Name: Plutonian Poker
Description:
Plutonian Poker is a set collection game for 2-6 players that uses Looney Pyramids.  Players claim pyramids from a shared pool, building scoring combinations with their claimed pyramids.  The twist is that you are not allowed to rearrange your claims once you've made them, making the more complicated and valuable sets riskier to achieve.

Rules here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Plutonian_Poker

Name: Pyrinoes
Description:
Pyrinoes is a game for two players that combines two game systems: double-six dominoes and Looney Pyramids.  Players begin the game with a supply of dominoes and two colors of pyramids.  Players take turns adding pieces from their supply to the chain of played pieces, either by placing dominoes or by creating a "pyrino" out of pyramids.  When one person runs out of pieces, the round ends, and the winner scores points.  Subsequent rounds are played until one player has earned 100 points.  Pyrinoes adds strategic depth to classic Dominoes by giving the players the ability to create a desired piece, but at the risk of revealing critical information to the opponent.

Rules here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Pyrinoes

Name: Wildlife Lotto
Description: This is a nature-themed Lotto game. One player is designated "caller" and every player is given a large 3x3 card featuring images of wildlife. The pictures are unique to the each card are not repeated, unlike traditional Lotto. The caller has a deck of smaller cards that have been shuffled and placed face down. One by one, the caller turns over the cards and announces the name of the animal or plant shown on the card. If someone has a match, he claims the card and places it on the corresponding art on his large card. The game is over when a player has completed all nine matches on his large card. That player is declared the winner.

Name: Occupation of the Rhineland
Description:
The tiniest of games I have seen, I think this one is smaller than Panzerpranks?

4 hexes one counter

The object is for the Germans to occupy the Rhineland just prior to WWII. A die must be provided by the players. The sequence is pretty simple, the German player attempts to enter the hexes of the Rhineland. Rolling on a chart to see if his move is successful. The French player does nothing.  With a bad roll a French 75 goes off accidentally stopping the 
German Move. The German wins if he enters all hexes of the Rhineland, the French player wins if he does SOMETHING!

Tounge in cheek, simple effective rules, I do see that it needs a little errata though.

Name: Dance Charades
Description:
You’ve seen the sprinkler, you’ve even seen the lawn mower, but you have never seen anything like this. 
 You get a 40 second song clip during your turn. You dance as many items as you can. 
For the items other people guess correctly, you get one point. 
BUT HERE IS THE TWIST! You get rewarded points from others if your dancing is awesome. Everyone else has tokens and can reward your dancing awesomeness with up to three tokens per turn. 
This keeps people dancing and not just charading.


What comes in the box:
300 dance cards
Score pad
300 tokens
Audio CD with 40 songs

Name: Zombie Close
Description:
A Zombie strategy game for 3 or more players, where the person who survives the longest wins.

Each player controls 1 Human and 3 Zombies. Aim of the game is to be the last Human to survive the Zombie attack. Each player takes turns to run from the shuffling Zombies, then each takes turns to move their Zombies to try and corner and bite the other players' Humans. Humans generally move a fixed number of 6 speaces, whilst Zombies move according to a dice roll (1-6). Get bitten as a Human and you still have 5 turns - or until you get bitten again if sooner - until you become a Zombie yourself. Cards take it beyond a basic roll 'n' move, with positive (for yourself) and negative (for others) special effects.

There are various cards that can either help or hinder.

Name: Warmachine: Wrath
Description:
Warmachine: Wrath is the first expansion of Warmachine since the launch of the game's second edition which is known as MK II.

Wrath introduces an entirely new model type; the battle engine. Battle engines do not replace Warjacks or Warriors, but instead provide players with survivable, concentrated firepower and a wealth of tactical options that will appeal to a wide broad range of playstyles.

Wrath also introduces another new model type; Ranking Officers. Ranking Officers give players more reason to field Mercenaries in their armies. They provide all the benefits from a typical unit attachment, but they also transform their Mercenary units into faction units subject to all of the spells, abilities and feats the faction has to offer.

Of course, Wrath also contain new models for all the different factions.

Name: "Oosehe"?
Description:
A card game featuring lovely images of animals.Each player chooses a different animal, from the 8 listed on the Key Card.
Cards are dealt out and kept by each player in a face-down stack. In his turn, a player must turn over the top card. If it matches any other face-up card, both players with the now matching cards must call "Oosehe"?, and name the animal now revealed. The first to do so, claims the matching cards plus all the cards beneath it.
The rules are a little strange in that you are asked to call the name as listed on the Key Card but as this name is also on the cards, players could just read the card itself. Maybe Victorian children found these animals exotic and not instantly recognisable.
The name of the game is pronounced "Oose he?", as rhyming with the phrase "Whose He?"

Name: Sefite
Description:
A rare card game for the late Victorian era. For once, it is not a Snap, Happy Families or Old Maid variant.
The cards have a fair amount of text on them (see images), not just the naval illustration. I am assuming that cards are revealed and interaction takes place between the different kinds of vessels now on view. The Battleship can protect 'Simple cards' drawn against a Destroyer. The Cruiser is a 'Simple card' itself and needs the protection of the Battleship. And other ships have their 'rules', the Destroyer, the Merchantman and the Torpedo Boat. A Victorian boy must have been thrilled with this game, with its military links.
By the way, the odd title is intended to be pronounced 'Sea-Fight'.

Name: FQ3
Description:
"FQ3" is a board game that recreates the world of the car races. With a mixture of strategy, action, control of risk, and some touches of role, FQ3 represents a real way (and funny too), all that happens inside and outside of the tracks.

"FQ3" has 3 difficulty levels of rules to satisfy all kind of players;

- BASIC RULES: Aimed at casual and undemanding gamers.

- ADVANCED RULES: For fans of race games. These rules are more realistic, and involved all sorts of factors: such as types of tires, fuel loads, setting the car, kers, yellow flag, Safety Car, moral of drivers and injuries, etc.

- MANAGER MODE: Only for those who  drink gasoline! In this game mode, in addition to the role of pilot, you will assume the role of team manager. You will manage the economy, hiring drivers, sponsors, engineers, desing the car and evolve it. The years pass and drivers will gain experience and they will improve their skills.

SUMMARY OF GAMEPLAY: The Friday of the GP, the player must decide the strategy (number of stops, tires, and fuel load).

On Saturday, will be held the pole position, it follows a mathematical operation involving various modifiers (skills of the pilot, car performance, fuel load, tires, moral, blunders, and a roll of 1d20).

The race takes place the Sunday.
The circuit is composed of squares. The cars will go moving by circuit as many squares as the speed (gear dependent) of your car.
When the cars reach the corners, the drivers must brake and accelerate. Brakes and accelerates with a d100. Drivers have an ability to Brake and Accelerate that used to take curves (higher or lower depending on driver).
These skills will be modified by the fuel load, tire types, and how close you decide to brake and accelerate.
The risk you take in the curves is important; you can take away your opponents, but be careful!, fail brake roll or acceleration roll will damage your car.

The game stands on four pillars:
The driver, the car, the pit stop mechanics, and the circuit.
Each of them has many different skills, qualities or details that make it different from the others.

This is a brief summary of how to play. There are many and funny rules, such as kers, spin, overtaking, blunders, drivers' virtues, drive's defects, safety car,etc.

Name: Aquarius: Dragon
Description:
This is a card you can add to your Aquarius deck to alter the gameplay to resemble Seven Dragons.

The front of the card is an image of the Aquarius Dragon, and the back of the card contains the instructions on how to use this card. It acts as a new starter card, and is initially wild.

As you play Actions to the discard pile, the Aquarius Dragon changes color to match the top Action card in the discard pile.  You can also choose to play an Action to the discard pile without fulfilling the action in order to just change the color of the Dragon.  Or you choose can play an Action card to the bottom of the discard pile to get the benefit of the action without changing the Dragon.

Name: Seven Dragons: Shuffle Hands
Description:
This is an Action that you can add in to your Seven Dragons deck.

When played, you gather up all players' hands, shuffle them, and deal them out among the players, starting with yourself. It has part of the rainbow dragon's image in the center, and when played to the top of the discard pile, it causes the Silver Dragon to act as a wild card.

This is the action card from the game's predecessor, Aquarius, that was left of the Seven Dragons re-implementation.

Name: Ben 10: Mission
Description:
Ben 10 is on an important mission, join him on his quest in this Ben 10 Mission Board Game. A fantastic adventure for 2 to 4 players aged 5 and up.

Travel around the board collecting power tokens, transforming into alien warriors and battling Ben's many enemies. The first player to collect enough power tokens and reach the finishing square wins the game!

Included:

* Game board
    * 4 playing pieces
    * Die
    * 12 power tokens
    * Instructions

Name: LiberalOpoly
Description:
LiberalOpoly follows the format of Parker Brothers Monopoly.

Instead of trading properties, as is the case of Monopoly, LiberalOpoly player's trade political favors in exchange for financial support from interest groups. Instead of Chance and Community Chest cards, LiberalOpoly features "Bushwacked" and "Meet the Press" Cards, which are an especially creative aspect of the game.

The cover image for LiberalOpoly portrays John Kerry as Mr. Monopoly, with cane in hand, popping out of the "O" in LiberalOpoly. It also features an intoxicated Ted Kennedy drunk on the lawn, John Edwards chasing an ambulance, Michael Moore eating cheeseburgers and Barbara Streisand flying over the Hollywood hills on a broom

Name: Ranger Rick-opoly
Description:
Ranger Rick-opoly has all the fun of a traditional property game with some wild twists.
Go hiking and be a caretaker for your favorite animals in the Deep Green Wood. Raise the rent by collecting blocks of fresh CLEAN AIR and trade them in for a big PINE TREE! Learn fun facts on each animal deed... and MAKE CAMP and join Ranger Rick and his friends on a wonderful adventure.

Name: Alberta-opoly
Description:
Alberta-opoly was created with the help of Albertans.

Alberta-Opoly hits the highlights with some of the province’s most interesting landmarks. Full of buffalo, crops, and parks, this game is truly about Alberta. So choose your token and roll the dice.
You may be the new owner of Dinosaur Provincial Park or meet aliens at the province’s UFO landing pad.

Name: Parade-opoly
Description:
Take part in a favorite holiday tradition with the Parade-opoly board game.

Just roll the dice and march your way through Columbus Circle and down to 34th and Broadway with all the famous floats and balloons of Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

Name: Pond Hockey-opoly
Description:
Pond Hockey-Opoly is a game that brings back the memories of frozen feet, runny noses, fresh air and the way hockey is meant to be played.

It has all the action of a traditional property trading game... along with some nifty stick-handling fun! Buy your favorite ponds and rinks, then collect «warm-up shacks» and trade them in for «arenas». As you play, turn over the deeds to learn interesting facts about each pond or rink.

Name: Storm over Pearl Harbor
Description: A new game of Storm over series.  This time, the game covers the whole Pacific war from Pearl Harbor to the end of war. One year is covered with 3 game turns. The map covers from West coast to Bombay. The game engine is an advanced storm over system in which you can build your own card hands by selecting cards. Though the game covers naval actions and air combat, the most important thing is occupying the territory by Army. The victory is determined by Victory points which mainly come from the important land areas.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Outer Space & Reversteam
Description:
Two out-of-this-world maps challenge your railroad building and delivering prowess.

Outer Space requires "straight on" deliveries to ensure you don't shoot right by your destination, as well as a handy set of wormholes to get your goods across the galaxy quickly. Things are quite different in Reversteam, where not only has the traditional "great lakes" area been altered, but the cities want every kind of good except for their color.

Available as part of the 2011 Steam/Age of Steam preorder pack from Bézier Games.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Australia & Tasmania
Description:
Go down under as you build railways across the uninhabitable Outback and through mysterious Tasmania.

In Australia, quickly build along the expensive coastal regions of the East Coast and find a way to reach the cities in the west, which will pay more for goods delivered to them. Tasmania requires you to build an efficient distribution system for all of its towns and cities as goods are shuttled in from the mainland.

Part of the Spiel 2011 AoS/Steam map pack from Bézier Games.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: African Diamond Mines & Taiwan Cube Factories
Description:
Harness the power of railroads to dig up diamonds and produce much sought after wooden cubes.

African Diamond Mines has you setting up a mining railroad deep underground to access valuable diamonds with a new depth counter that adds an additional level of strategy. Ramp up production with Taiwan Cube Factories, as you combine resources to produce new ones to keep the new infrastructure in Taiwan booming.

Part of the 2011 Steam/Age of Steam map pack from Bézier Games.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Orient Express & Disoriented Express
Description:
Special preorder-only maps that are challenging in new ways.

Orient Express is the classic European channel between Paris and Istanbul, where moving passengers quickly and effectively is your goal. On the other hand, Disoriented Express will have you scratching your head trying to undo the knots created by foreign, yet familiar landscapes. â€‹

These two maps are available ONLY as part of the Spiel 2011 AoS/Steam map pack from Bézier Games.

Name: Answer That!
Description: This "Scene It?" variant is based on the Christian children's radio show "Adventures in Odyssey." Players take turns rolling a die and moving their character around a game board. There are five different kinds of trivia categories that can be landed on, including two that utilize a DVD player. First person to get to the end of the board wins. The DVD also features a boardless "Lightning Play" mode said to be best for fast play or a party situation.

Name: Serious Pursuit
Description:
Subtitle: The "Evil Empire" Exposed

This is a military trivia training game developed by the United States armed forces.

"The basis of the game is an understanding of the Soviet Union through its history, personalities, capabilities and its allies.  Soviet seapower is more than just ships, aircraft and doctrine.  It is centered around the men.  This game will provide you with an understanding of these sailors.  There is nothing trivial about the Soviet Navy.  They are our greatest maritime adversary.

The following play equipment or implements are included with the game:

Colorful Game Board showing militaristic spaces printed in English and Russian; Assortment of Different Colored Wooden 'Ships'; Assortment of Different Colored Playing Chits; Five sets of question cards; Large Rules Book with Answer Key; and, 2 Dice."

Name: Ostrich Circus
Description:
The game consists of the following:


     60 playing cards, each with one of 6 pictures of ostriches performing various feats or being the victim of various misfortunes
     4 declaration cards indicating whether players want to fold or continue
     "Chicken" chips that are taken as a penalty when folding
     Start player card


The goal of the game is to get either one or two cards of a particular picture, as these earn you points. If you have three or more of a picture, points are deducted.

The players each get 2 playing cards, which are kept hidden from other players. At the beginning of each round, 2 cards from the deck are dealt face up and 3 face down. After players indicate whether they will continue or fold, a face down card is turned over. This continues until all 5 cards are turned over. At that point, remaining players who didn't fold will receive the cards. Players who folded receive a number of chicken chips equal to the number of face down cards plus one.

At the end of the game, having one of a particular picture card is worth 2 points and two of that picture card are worth 6 points. Having three or more is a minus 3/4/5/etc. points. Each chicken chip is minus 2 points. The person with the most points is the winner.

The theme is based on the Japanese comedy trio, Ostrich Club.

Name: Yellow Tavern
Description:
Bullet to Man combat in the Civil War.

This was an insert in some of Battleline Games' boxed games in the mid 1970's. It simulates Confederate general Jeb Stuart's fatal encounter at Yellow Tavern in 1864.

The game is a simple, solitaire hex and counter wargame featuring a traditional CRT and tables for movement. The goal of Jeb Stuart is to survive as long as possible.

The game is more humorous than serious and no other outcome other than Jeb Stuart's demise is possible, although it can be delayed.

Name: Armageddon: The End is Near
Description:
The game is played in a scenario on the brink of the Doomsday. Everything is scarce, raiders roaming free, nanotechnology is being used freely and natural resources are coming to an end. The so called government is trying to crowd control an inevitable riot but what they really want is to leave the planet before the end. However, only a few people know this plot.

Each player is a faction opposing the government but due to the latest information leak you will be struggling to participate in the escape route. Or you can start a Coup and take over control. Game ends when world ends or when the Coup is triggered. Whoever had the most influence wins the game and explores the new dawn.

Armageddon is the first of a three-game trilogy telling the history of some surviving factions in a post-nuclear war environment.

It's mainly a dice placement game using dice "pips" to get whatever goods are remaining, fight over some decay buildings and government privileges. The game lasts 7 rounds and each round one space for gathering resources is taken away.

Taking its basis from Stone Age and Alien Frontiers, it's intended as a highly-tematic dice-placement games of struggle for survival.

Name: Quadruple Crossed
Description:
This is game #11 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

In this game, players start with 8 pieces on the board and 4 off.  Players try to get four of their pieces across the board, by either advancing them one space, or utilizing lines of pieces leap them over occupied spaces.  Either of these moves types can be used to either advance to an unoccupied space or off the board.

Name: InVicio
Description:
This is game #12 the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

In this game, players have the simple goal of being the first player to get all their pieces on the board. Players try to prevent their opponents from accomplishing this, by either performing custodial captures or jumps over pieces, with either of these moves causes pieces of their opponent to go back into their reserve.  The preventing of the placement of pieces along the outside of the board, unless the pieces are involved in capture, leads both to an ongoing exchange of captures and also driving the game to its conclusion.

Name: Halmette
Description:
This is Game #13 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This is a game that started as an attempt to come up with a game in the Halma family, which also includes Chinese Checkers.  As it developed, it began to take on its own flavor, which includes pieces starting off the board, sending enemy pieces back to their reserve area off the board when jumped, and exiting one's own pieces from a single space on the board.

Name: Juxt a Push
Description:
This is game #14 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

In this game, players try to either get their pieces into one contiguously connected group or reduce the number of enemy pieces to one.  This game is a hybrid of Groups and Lines of Action, on a smaller board and utilizing shifting lines of pieces.  As players shift pieces, they may end up pushing pieces of either player off the board, and out of play.  This reducing of pieces is a double-edged sword, as it both weakens a player, but also pushes them closer to possibly winning the game.

Name: Sllim
Description:
This is game #15 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

This is a game in an N-in-a-row game that turns the Mills/Morris family of games on its head. The game features the reverse winning objectives from normal games in the Mills family of games.  In this game the object is for the player to remove all their pieces from the board, instead of eliminating opponent's pieces from the board, by forming a line or square.  The name Sllim reflects that, as its name is the word “Mills” in reverse.  Sllim also shares the form a square pattern of Square Chess, which is played in Asia.

Name: Leaping Lillypads
Description:
A strategy game as players guide their Frog on a gourmet buffet across the lillypads.

In this simple strategy game, each player plays a Frog with his own special menu of what tastes good on the pond.  He moves his frog in large or small movements across the lillypads, snapping up insects as he goes.  The trick is in only getting the insects you like more than the ones you don't like.  Each Frog has his own special secret diet, you don't know what each frog is after.  Be careful, predators surround the pond looking for a meal of frog.

The simple mechanics can be learned in minutes by children and adults alike.  Play is quick and intuitive, setup is fast with variable board setup to change the game every time.  Random menus for each frog ensures uncertainty about other players intentions and strategies.

The game includes rule expansions to challenge experienced gamers and those who become experienced with the game.

Designed as Print n' Play, they game can be produced in either a high or low quality finish.

Available July 2011.

Name: Hello Kitty Muffinsspelet
Description:
Hello Kitty Muffinsspelet (Swedish. English translation: Hello Kitty The Cupcake game)

Game components:

Game Board,
4 Hello Kitty playing pieces,
1 6-sided die,
20 cupcake counters
4 Hello Kitty counters
4 Hello Kitty and Daisy counters
4 treat tokens
1 rulebook

The basic idea of the the game is to roll the die and move around the edge of the board where the counters are laid out. When you land on a counter you flip it over and either take an action or keep it, depending on what the counter shows. The goal is to collect 4 of the same kind of cupcake and then move to one of the cupcakes depicted in the center of the board and put a treat token on top. The first player to do this wins the game.

Name: All About Syracuse
Description:
The object of the game is for players to travel on the gameboard to the locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to their residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on their shopping list wins the game!

The board is made up of 6 oversized jigsaw puzzle pieces. It shows local businesses that players must travel to via the streets and highways. Spaces with question marks indicate a player must draw a Surprise card. Players must travel to the places on their shopping lists and return to their residence to win the game.

Name: I Luv London
Description:
Localized version of the popular family board game Monopoly.
Players roll the dice and move around the (Canadian city!) London buying properties and trading.

Name: Pássaros
Description:
Birds are envied by humans and watched since dawn of history. Birding is one of the greatest hobbies in the world. In this game, you are a bird photographer, competing to get the more precious photo collection of Brazilian birds by travelling through all the regions of the Brazil.

Pássaros (Birds) is a light strategy game in which the players, as bird photographers, try to get the best photos of Brazilian birds while traveling in all Brazilian regions.

Pássaros has two game rules included, a basic rules, in that the players travel and take photos in any desired order. In the end, players receive points for the most different types of birds, for each three of a kind photos and also considering the resources they did not spent during the game.

In the advanced rules, players must travel first, and take photos later, also, the birds themselves fly all along the board. All points categories in basic play still counts, but also players get points for having the most photos in each categories.

The game is played in five rounds of three turns each, and during each round, the players are considered to be traveling, and the photos taken are in "unsecure" memory cards, that can be lost. Only at the end of each round the photos are downloaded to a secure server.

Name: Poker Carré
Description:
In Poker Carré, players add cards to a grid and try to create sequences of at least four numbers (e.g., 1-2-3-4), sets of at least three cards of the same suit, and sets of at least three cards of the same value.

Why is this difficult? The deck consists of 49 cards – seven suits of seven cards numbered 1-7 – and each player starts with a hand of four cards, while nine cards are randomly laid out in a 3x3 grid. On a turn, a player adds a card to the grid adjacent to at least one card already on the table, with the restriction that at least one of the adjacent cards must have a value exactly one higher or one lower than the card being played. That player then draws a replacement card. Once all the cards have been played, tally the points; the player with the highest score wins.

Name: Vampire Hunter's Roller-Dice Game
Description:
Vampire Hunter’s Roller-Dice Game. All Alchemy dice games come in the same metal mint tin, Alchemy Gothic Aleus Occulta.

Object:
A two-player game, played in two turns.
Each player takes his turn to see who can be the most successful Vampire, roaming the night and attacking victims, before the Vampire Hunter eventually kills him.

Game Play:
In each turn, one player is the Vampire, while the other is the Vampire Hunter. When the Vampire is eventually killed, the players reverse roles for the second turn and the Vampire who finishes the best ‘score’ of victims, wins.
Each turn lasts as many nights as the Vampire can stay alive, with each die roll representing one night. The Vampire rolls first and notes his ‘score’. The Vampire Hunter then rolls to try to kill the Vampire or save his victims. This continues with the Vampire adding his score, until he is eventually killed.

The Vampire’s roller-die is marked with:
3 bats        = 3 victims this night.
2 bats        = 2 victims this night.
1 bat            = 1 victim this night.
Sunrise        = No victims caught on this night.
Fangs        = Attacks the Vampire Hunter and wins two free nights, (without a Vampire Hunter die roll).
Coffin        = Remains resting in Coffin for the night.

The Vampire Hunter’s roller-die is marked with:
Garlic        = Saves (cancels) all Vampire victims this night.
Crucifix        = Defends against, (cancels) Fangs.
Decapitation    = Kills the Vampire, if not in his Coffin.
Stake        = Kills the Vampire, if caught in his Coffin.

Name: MiniMonfa: 2 promo cards
Description:
Two promotional cards for the game MiniMonfa.

MiniMonFa is a 2-player, non-collectible card game that allows you to become an Archmage who must set up his dungeon in order to defend himself from the ongoing attacks of the local heroes, always covetous of glory, treasures, and experience points.

You have to build your dungeon with great mastery and shrewd strategy to stop the heroes: to achieve such a result, you can place insidious traps and unleash powerful and cunning creatures.

Besides defending your underground dwelling, you will have to lead the fearless heroes you recruited to get rid of the competing Archmage who is weakening your grip on the surrounding areas.

Defend your own dungeon and assail your enemy's! Will you find the way to manage both? Are you ready to try?

The two promotional cards add Rigor Mortis himself to the game, as well as a bunch of Goblin Henchmen for Rigor Mortis. Rigor Mortis has three new abilities (Henchmen; Deadly Gaze and Firephoenix), his goblin servants won't die, but instead flee back to your hand if the Rigor Mortis card is in play.

Name: Polly Pocket Pollyville Card Game
Description:
From the box:
Travel with Polly and her friends to explore 18 fun-filled locations in Pollyville.  Along the way you'll stop at their favorite places: the Pet Shop, Pizzeria, Zoo, Beach and more.

The adventure starts by collecting three cards to complete a scene.  The first player who matches four scenes wins the game!

Gameplay: Each player starts with seven cards.  On each turn, a player draws one card, then lays down any matches they have (of 3 cards).  If a match is laid down, the player draws three new cards.  The player can continue to lay down matches and take 3 new cards until they can make no more matches.  To complete the turn, the player discards one card.  Cards cannot be picked up from the discard pile, but that pile is reshuffled to become the draw pile if that pile is depleted.  First player to complete 4 matches wins the game.

Name: K-Stateopoly
Description:
From the box:
Buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board.  Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas.  Academic Probation sends you home...or make the Dean's List and collect a $200 scholarship.  Play the traditional version or the 1 hour version.

This Monopoly variant utilizes locations and cards appropriate to the campus of Kansas State University.

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook Volume II
Description:
After releasing Star Fleet Battles Expansion #1, Expansion #2, and Expansion #3 all of the rules were reformatted into the Commander's Rulebook system.

In the new format, all rules were brought together and divided into separate topics.  The rulebooks were intended to be separated at the binder and placed loosely in a 3-ring binder.  New rules could be inserted, and each update included a new comprehensive table of contents.

Commander's Rulebook #1 included the original basic and advanced rules as well as the new rules and errata from Expansion #1.  This rulebook contained the rules and errata from Expansions #2 and #3.

For those who already had the expansions, the rulebooks were sold separately.  For those who were new to the game, they were sold in re-packaged box formats Star Fleet Battles Volume I and Star Fleet Battles Volume II, respectively.

Re-implements:

     Star Fleet Battles
     Star Fleet Battles Designer's Edition
     Star Fleet Battles Expansion #2
     Star Fleet Battles Expansion #3


Re-implemented-by:

     Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition

Name: Captain's Log #2
Description:
CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 features the short story and scenario, REFINER'S FIRE, by James Ashauer.  The story details the Romulan attempt to destroy the Gorn Heavy Cruiser Reptilicon as a prelude to an invasion of the Gorn Confederation.  The decisive battle occurred at the Gorn/Federation border.  The Scenario allows up to four players to recreate this climactic final battle.

The second feature of CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 is "Who's Who in the Star Fleet Universe."  A brief background is given on the key people who are involved in the continuing creation of the STAR FLEET BATTLES gaming system.

CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 also includes the new Impulse Movement Charts for 8, 16, and 24 Impulses and three new Command Cruisers: The Gorn Allosaurus Rex, the Hydran Lord Marshal, and the Romulan Superhawk.

Over twenty new scenarios are included in CAPTAIN'S LOG #2.  Some scenario titles are: "Mutiny on the Demonslayer," "A Question of Franchise," "Ambush!," and "The Rain of Terror."  Also included is the Campaign Game "The Expedition" which allows players to recreate the Hydran attempt to drive through the Klingon Empire.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Belmont Stakes Handicap Horse Racing Game
Description: Handicap Horse Racing is basically a solitaire game which recreates a horse race. It takes the Daily Racing Form Past Performances and shows how to analyze it and fill out a Handicap Form Analysis Sheet. The player then alternates turns between using a spinner for the Analysis Sheet and playing Action Racing Cards. The box states that players will learn to read horse racing performance charts and how to handicap (predict) race results for all types of bets including; Daily Double, Quinella, Exacta and Tri-fecta. A clever and unique approach.

Name: Lerne München kennen: 300 neue Fragen
Description: This expansion for Lerne MÃ¼nchen kennen contains 300 new trivia cards on the city of München.
Families: Series: Lerne ... kennen (Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche München)

Name: Golden Trivia Cards: Disney Edition
Description:
Cards set for Golden Trivia Game Disney Edition.
Contains 216 new Trivia Cards

Name: Golden Trivia Game: Major League Baseball Edition
Description:
Knock your opponent out of the box as you compete for points by answering trivia questions in six categories: Hitting, Pitching, FranchiseFacts, All-Stars and Awards, Post-Season Play and Names and Numbers. Select the category and point value of your choice as you duel against fellow baseball buffs in an effort to clinch the trivia pennant.  A must for followers of the American pastime everywhere, so...Play Ball!

The object is to be the first player to reach a predetermined number of points by answering questions.

Name: Golden Trivia Game: National Football League (NFL) Edition
Description: The object of NFL Trivia game is to be the first player to reach a predetermined number of points by answering National Football League trivia questions.  The questions are divided into six categories (see contents).

Name: Barbarians Attack!
Description:
A horde of angry barbarians has landed on a remote island inhabited by peaceful villagers! Eager to please their capricious king, the barbarians have organized the conquest into a contest, with each faction vying to send home the best selection of captives. And so the warriors ravage the island in search of specimens from the strongest tribe to send back to the mainland.

Barbarians Attack is a strategy game that encourages players to craft the deadliest barbarian army. A player may acquire his choice of leadership traits and special powers during the game until his barbarian warriors are pillaging experts. The game rewards both sound tactics and clever power combinations.

Each turn, players use their allotted action points to acquire captives though battle and other means. Players earn fame in battle which they can spend on a selection of additional powers. When the island has been drained of captives, the player who has the most captives from the strongest tribe (the tribe with the most villagers remaining on the island) wins the game.

Name: Ouro de Tolo Nitroglicerina
Description:
A new card for your miner to use in Ouro de Tolo game. More powerfull than the Dinamite, but is this any good?

You can use Nitroglicerina to pick up as many stones from the mine as you desire all at once, but you will keep all Foul's Gold that came with it. How many stones do you dare to take?

This free Ouro de Tolo expansion can be found inside PÃ¡ssaros

Name: Ascension: Return of the Fallen – Kythis, the Gatekeeper Promo
Description:
The Kythis, the Gatekeeper is a promo card given to those that preorder a copy of Ascension: Return of the Fallen.

Cost: 7 Power to defeat

Monster

When Kythis enters the center row, take the top card of the center deck and place it face down underneath him. If Kythis is banished replace him with that card.
If Kythis has an Event card under him when defeated, banish it. If Kythis is banished, the Event card attempts to enter the center row and becomes the Event and is then replaced with the next card. 
If Kythis has a Fate card under him when defeated, it does not trigger. However, if Kythis is banished, the Fate card beneath him will trigger.

In the event that a Rat Queen enters the Center Row while Kythis is in play, set the reward card under Kythis to the side prior to shuffling the Center Row cards and placing Giant Rats on top of them. When the Giant Rat covering Kythis is banished or defeated, place the reward card back under Kythis.

Reward: Gain 5 Honor and acquire or defeat the card underneath Kythis.  [You may not acquire or defeat the card under him if defeated in the void, it only triggers if he is in the center row.]

Name: Horsefeathers
Description:
Horsefeathers is a bluffing-and-betting dice game requiring only twelve 6-sided dice, a dice cup, a handful of tokens, and a box of poker chips in order to play.

Players roll one die each turn and add it to the dice that are already in the center of the table.  These dice are grouped by number.  When there is one die of a given number (say, one 6), it is referred to as a "single"; when there are two dice of a given number (say, two 3s), they are referred to as a "double"; there can never be three dice (a "triple") of the same number in the center of the table.

When players roll their die, they conceal it under the dice cup and then declare its value.  If, however, the number rolled would create a triple, then the player must call it something else.  The player must lie.

Other players can challenge the declaration by calling "Horsefeathers."  If the rolling player was lying, then the challenge is successful and the challenger takes a token from the center of the table; the lying player is out of the round.  If, on the other hand, the rolling player was telling the truth, then the *challenger* is out of the round.

The goal in each round is to be the last player standing -- that player gets the pot of chips.

Play continues in this fashion until the last token is taken.  The current round is finished, payouts are made based on any token discrepancies, and then the chips are counted.  The player with the most chips is the winner.

If you want to give it a try, the rules can be found on the game's homepage, http://boardgameforge.wordpress.com/horsefeathers/.

Name: Death Mesa (fan expansion for BANG!)
Description:
Death Mesa is an unofficial expansion to BANG! the card game, designed to improve the element of player elimination by having eliminated players remain in and influence the game as ghosts.

Ghosts have no life points, no distance constraints, cannot die, and also draw from a specialized deck of cards called the Dead Men's Deck. Cards from this deck allow the ghosts to possess the living, bequeath items from their will, inspire or weaken others, reveal information on cards in player's hands, warn of impending doom, and so forth. Ghosts however, can spoil each other's plans.

With a strong thematic background, Death Mesa should add to the fun of BANG! and draw new fans to it who could not stand the player elimination.

Name: Trade-off: The Land Use Planning Game
Description:
Trade-off, the land-use simulation game, allows participants to experience a wide range of community development situations in a relatively short period of time. Trade-off players will think about land-use and resource problems they have probably never considered before.
In Trade-off, 3 to 7 players act as Planning Commissioners, serving to regulate the actions of the 4-8 players who represent the Agricultural/Forestry, Industrial, Residential, and Commercial Center/Tourism Developers. The Developers aim to build their respective projects by purchasing and improving land on a grid map of a river valley. Meanwhile, the Commission, along with a Banker and Recorder, must maintain the area's environment and settle disputes between developers.
Time is measured in Trade-off with a Monopoly-type track running around the board. A full run of the track represents an in-game year. At each space on the track, events occur that affect the Developers, such as stock market fluctuations or environmental damage.
The game ends when the players agree to finish. At that time, the Developers assess the extent of their accomplishments, while weighing them against the environmental damage they potentially caused. Trade-off is primarily a classroom aid, and so discussion of actual land development is encouraged. No "winning" Development team is chosen officially, but players may use the map and each player's wealth to make a decision regarding victory.

Name: Battle Break
Description:
Theme:
It's 2111 and aliens have come to earth--to dominate!

Game-play:
On a grid, wage war with your army. There are four factions, but cooperation between them: Gaia (red) and Coeurl (green) versus Empire (yellow) and Alien (blue). Figures are stacked onto chips that reflect their level of power and life. The chips can also be spent to execute special moves--found under the figure bases. The round is basically split into 4 phases, and battles are resolved with a combination of movement (including flight), special moves, and dice rolls.

Packaging:
As of April 2011, four factions have been released in encounter boxes, the red/green Keruberosu Reckless Plan, and the yellow/blue Kuresento (Crescent) Ambition Platoon. Each preconstructed starter includes a team-up of two factions (4 figs), a battle mat, a rulebook, 4 castle coins, 5 gaia coins, 5 kail coins and one battle die. One encouter box has only enough material for 1 player--and the castle coins are required to play. Also available are randomized booster boxes--from which capsule vending machines are also stocked. Larger figures must be assembled, and all boosters come with an additional battle coin. All figures are pre-painted.

Series 2 was released June of 2011.
Series 3 was released August of 2011.

Name: Cthentacle: At the Mountings of Madness
Description:
The second expansion for Call of Cthentacle.  It adds two new characters, Bligh the sailor and Hostein, an explorer.

This new game style has a new goal - reaching the lost city of O'Riyeh.  To begin play you lay out six markers corresponding to the following locations:

1. Spankham Asylum
2. Friskatonic University
3. Innmouth
4. Dunbitch
5. The Mountings of Madness
6. O'Riyeh

The winner of the game is the first person to reach O'Riyeh.  You start at Spankham Asylum where your investigation starts with the wild and crazy stories of one of the inmates.  From there you need to gather clues to advance.

Enhances the basic game by allowing characters to go back to Spankham Asylum and start over again instead of being knocked out of the game when they get "spooged".

Name: Our Sonovabitch
Description:
A rapid-fire "print-and-play" game where players have to sell arms to various unsavoury customers across North Africa and the Middle East.

The order of play is through a series of quick rounds, with both players racing to claim territories - either as selling opportunities or to shame the opposing player for already selling weapons there.

The tricky decisions arrive as the best customers are the ones most actively repressing their own people (popular uprisings are great for business). Getting called out on selling arms to politically dodgy customers means your diplomats will be shamed into retirement and your ability to do further deals is then reduced.

The first player to sell all their weapons wins.

From the game:

"Franklin D. Roosevelt is reported to have said of the Nicaraguan dictator, Anastasio Somoza, "He may be a son of a bitch, but he's our son of a bitch". The story is apocryphal, but it tells a truth that persists today. We will support, encourage and sell arms to the worst of humanity as long as it is convenient to do so. Once the relationship sours, however, it's time to back out as quickly and quietly as possible, preferably invading in the wake to claim a righteous victory for democracy and freedom!

To sample the exciting diplomatic thrills of global politics, we bring you this game. All it takes is about 15 minutes, 30 coins, 3 dice, a determination to sell weapons to anyone and the cunning to avoid being caught."

Name: Supervivientes
Description: This game board is based on the TV show "Supervivientes" (The Spanish version of "Survivors"). The board depicts some islands were the players must gather food and resources to survive. The game has two phases. In the first, there are two teams competing. In the second, the members of the winning team must compete between them to be the one and only survivor left, the winner.

Name: Marto
Description:
A set collecting game. One player is assignated to be the Auctioneer. He takes no part in the actual play but he sells cards, checks sets and settles any questions from the players (The rules say his word is binding.)

Each player has an equal number of counters (not provided) and will gain some and forfeit some during the game. New cards are auctioned each round but players must bid 'blind' so they don't know what they are bidding for. If a player gets a set of two, they may 'cash it in' or they may keep it to try to get the third card of each set as this will increase the award from the counter pool.

The Magistrates set is a penalty set so you need to avoid collecting them.

The player with the most counters after all cards have been matched, wins.

Name: Jälkipeli
Description:
Simple whole-family card game. Animal track cards are distributed to players, who then play them on corresponding animal cards. Player can also ask another player for a card, kind of like Go Fish.

Whoever plays the fifth card for the animal, gets the animal cards. Animal cards are worth points in the end.

Name: Rapuralli
Description:
Simple board game for small children. The game is a simple roll and move effort, teaching colours, shapes and basic board game skills.

There are three variants in the rules: game with colours, game with shapes and game with both shapes and colours.

Name: Hansa 1400
Description:
An expansion map for Hansa, the launch of which is planned for July/August 2011. Available for online play at Schacht's website.

Uses the same rules as the basic game, and may be combined with the Extrakcarte/Changing Winds expansion rules:
- may sail (roll) against the wind (direction of the arrows) for 2 coins
- end-game bonuses of 2/3/4/5VP for player with tallest stack of markets / who triggered last round / markets in most cities / most single-barrel tokens sold.

Name: Street Basketball
Description:
Basketball on the blacktop, fast and physical half court 3-on-3:  that's Street Basketball, a two-player flicking game played on a custom wood surface.

Each player has 3 discs representing the players on his or her team.  Players take turns flicking their discs driving and defending, and passing and shooting the basketball disc.  Each time the basketball drops into the hole in front of the backboard, your team scores a point--two points if you launch from behind the arc.  Thematic action Cards can be used at key points in the game to change the momentum in your favor.

The rules and cards are available to make a do-it-yourself version.  Build the game, and check the rock!

(Note: included is a Soccer game on the opposite side of the board that plays similar to air hockey)

Name: Zombie High School Card Game
Description:
The zombies are coming! Zombies are invading Zombie High (go figure) and it's up to you to save your fellow classmates. Run, fight and outsmart the zombies while trying to save the others. Take too many wounds and you'll become a zombie - then it's feasting time on your fellow students as you try to eat their brains.

A Frantic Game of Survival in a school invaded by zombies!

GAMEPLAY:
The three decks (30 zombie, 30 victim, and 60 action cards) are shuffled and each player is given a random victim. A roll of a d6 determines where the zombies come from.
Then the torture(fun) begins.
A victim draws one card and then takes an action of fighting zombies, fleeing from zombies, or cause another to follow.

But if your victim takes too many wound cards, your player turns into a zombie then must attack other victims or heal.

If everyone becomes a zombie or the zombie and victim decks are dealt out the game ends.

Components: 30 victim and zombie cards, 18 wound cards, 60 action cards, 2 six-sided dice and rules

Name: Heroscape: Arrival of the Master
Description: Master Win Chiu Woo was a promotional figure distributed free of charge at the 2007 Comic-Con, for use in HeroScape series of games. The figure sculpt is identical to one of the Shaolin Monks, though repainted in the yellow and gray of the sixth general, Aquilla. A unique hero, Master Woo improves the attack, defense, and mobility of Shaolin Monk squads.

Name: TOT Trivia
Description:
Over 600 questions and answers
A complete set of illustrated Alphabet flash cards
A complete set of illustrated Number flash cards (1-9)
Ideal for home, or compact for travel. Game complete on its own or a great add-on to other trivia games. Large durable cards; easy to follow rules.

Cards are large 3" x 5" yellow in color and have trivia designed for 3-6 year age group.
The first player or team of players to discard all 4 character cards by answering correctly wins.
to play:
Separate the 7 draw cards and the 16 character play cards.
mix up the remaining play cards and return to the box. distribute 4 identical character play cards to each player or team. stack the draw cards and lay face down in a draw pile.
player to the left of the quiz-master begins the game.
select draw card to determine question number to be answered by the current player. if 1-6 is drawn then answer the appropriate question if 7 then show the image on the reverse of the card.

Name: Mechropolis
Description:
Mechropolis is currently under development.

Mechropolis is a game of adventure, tactical combat, and choose your own adventure-like campaign play.  As added replay value, the game also incorporates a quicker player vs. player combat system included in the base game.

Taking place in the turmoil-ridden machine-city of Mechropolis, players assume the role of a mechanical freedom fighter, and travel the land in attempts to unhinge the current regime ruling the city with an iron (literally!) fist.

Players will have access to hundreds of items, weapons, skills, powers and upgrades, giving them fully customizable characters to play with.

Two ways to play:

1)  Follow the "choose your own adventure" style game play in the cooperative campaign and fight against the enemy using tactical combat on a large, interchangeable game board.   Players play against the game itself, no "dungeon master" needed.  While not in combat, player traverse the terrain on the overall city area map, visiting locales, buying/selling scavenged items, and fighting through random encounters.

2)  Play with or against your friends in player vs. player deathmatch, capture the flag, king of the hill, and other team games for a free for all, fun filled action packed gaming experience.

If you enjoyed PC games such as the Jagged Alliance series, X-COM, or Fallout: Tactics, you'll enjoy the tactical game play and customizable options in Mechropolis!

If you like games such as Star Wars: Epic Duals, Frag, and Gunslinger, but wish the game was more epic, strategic, less luck driven and deeper with more replay value, this will be the game for you!

Name: Memoir '44: Audie Murphy's Campaign
Description:
Designed by Jacques "jdrommel" David, this campaign does not focus on a particular front or on an important general. It is dedicated to the memory of all of the GIs that, like Audie Murphy, did their duty during the dark hours of World War II, and that went "To Hell and Back".

The 3rd US Infantry Division "Rock of the Marne" was one of the first divisions engaged in World War II. It fought in Sicily, in Italy (Salerne and Anzio landings), then in southern France, in Alsace, and finally in Germany, near the Czech border, where it finished the war.

The division suffered heavy losses throughout the war, as it was engaged in violent battles in Italy and in the Vosges mountains.

One of the bravest soldiers of this division was Audie Murphy, the most decorated American soldier of Second World War. He started the war as a private in the 15th US Infantry Regiment in 1943. By they time the war was over in 1945, he was a lieutenant with 38 medals, including the Medal of Honor. After the war, he became a Hollywood movie star and wrote an autobiographical book, "To Hell and Back", about his World War II experience.

Required expansions: Terrain Pack, Eastern Front

Recommended expansions: Winter Board, Campaign Book, Pacific Theater, Tigers in the Snow

Name: StalkerQuest
Description:
Players take the role of stalkers. They explore the Zone and try to survive in that environment. Each of them has its own purpose. The Zone very sensitive reacts to their every act, and the choice of the action can greatly influence not only on their fate, but also on the surrounding reality and to the fate of other stalkers.

In the beginning of the game each player gets a specific task, it's their personal goals, which induced to go into the Zone. Stepping outside the perimeter, they do not have to start to fulfill a task immediately, although it is well rewarded in victory points. They can simply explore the zone and get valuable artifacts. For their task fulfillment and searching artifacts they will receive a certain number of points.

Zone is a dangerous place, full of anomalies and unexplained creatures, a place where the other laws operate, neglect of which means to put themselves under the great risk. The zone is unpredictable. It will evaluate each action and make its verdict to each player.

Name: Snowman Meltdown
Description:
From the rules:
Players move "snowmen" (stacks of Icehouse), around a 4x4 board made of Piecepack tiles. The tiles specify the directions and distances the snowmen may travel. When players land on a tile containing opposing snowmen, they must melt one down or mug one. If the mugger’s victim capitulates, the mugger receives a coin that he can use to alter his movement or defend himself with a force field; otherwise, the victim is melted down one piece. Some tiles act as traps; if all your pieces are trapped, they melt, one by one. The winner is the last player with any snowmen left on the board.

Name: Witty Bananas
Description:
Witty Bananas is an abstract game with a funny jungle theme.

The goal of Witty Bananas is to be the first player to control one diagonal on the 4x4 square board

In turn, each player places a token (disc-shaped monkeys) on an empty square or on top of a stack of tokens he controls.
A player with one of his tokens on the top of a stack controls it.

When a stack is higher than several other around, then the stack of monkeys collapse and the active player reorder the tokens on the stacks around as he wants.

Rules and prototype can be downloaded on the publisher website.

Name: Volcano Island
Description:
Played with both Icehouse pyramids and a Piecepack set, players develop settlements on a 5x5 board according to a luck-free set of rules for building. (Neighboring settlements support or limit what can be built.)

Dice are rolled to determine in what round lava will begin to flow from a volcano in the center of the board. In each round after the eruption, one player extends the path of the lava in an orthogonal direction of his/her choosing -- destroying any settlement in that space. The game ends when a player is unable to move or when all lava tiles are placed. Players score remaining settlements by size.

Name: Dominion: Walled Village Promo Card
Description:
Released in June 2011 in the United States at the Origins Game Fair. We have just finished printing a new promo card that is a celebration of the 10 year anniversary of Carcassonne being selected as Spiel des Jahres. We will be offering it at our sales booths at Origins and Gencon and it will later be available through retail stores and BGG. It will also be available soon from our other-language partners.

Text:
Walled Village (Action - Cost 4 [coin])

+ 1 Cards
+2 Actions

At the start of Clean-up, if you have this and no more than one other Action card in play, you may put this on top of your deck.

The German Promo Card is named "Carcassonne" and will be given away with a Carcassonne Mini-Expansion "Die Schule"/"The School" for a fee of 3 Euros at SPIEL'11 in Essen. The collected fees will be donated to the 'Rainbow over Ghana' fundation and will be used to realize a school-project at Lake Bosumtwi, Ghana.

The German Promo "Carcassonne" was also part of a German Dominion Big Box sold by Metro Group (Galeria Kaufhof; Metro; Real; ...) in Fall 2011.

Part of the Dominion series.

Name: Clacto ; 4 and 4, Game with magnetic marbles
Description:
Game contents :
 - Game board
 - 3 Red magnetic marbles
 - 3 Blue magnetic marbles
 - 2 Black magnetic marbles

Every player gets 3 marbles of equal colour and a black one. Both players start at the same time laying their marbles in the 3 holes of the equally coloured flowers. He, who succeeds first in doing so, then places his black marble in the flower in the middle. When marbles are attracted together and click, both players start all over again.
Do not play on a metal surface.
Contains magnets.

Name: Heroes Inc 2
Description:
Heroes Inc 2 is an expansion to Heroes Inc. This expansion adds several scenarios, two new heroes - named Cat and Mouse, as well as new thugs for them to fight.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Heroes Inc 3
Description:
Heroes Inc 3 is an expansion to Heroes Inc. This expansion adds new heroes to the game, including Black Bolt and Ace of Spades, and adds a large scenario in which players are able to bid to determine what objects will be placed on the map. Each player has 10 object points to spend and can choose from a variety of sizes (the cost varies by size). These objects are placed by the players on the map and can be used as obstacles or weapons.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Heroes Inc 4: Character Builder
Description:
Heroes Inc 4: Character Builder is an expansion to Heroes Inc. This game includes several new heroes and villains that can be used in the other scenarios, as well as a detailed set of instructions for players to design their own heroes. A formula is given to determine the cost of new heroes which is then used to purchase the hero in scenarios.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Heroes Inc 5: Master Mind's Revenge
Description:
Heroes Inc 5: Master Mind’s Revenge is an expansion to Heroes Inc 1, 2, and 3. All three games are required to use this expansion. In this expansion, a villain named Master Mind is attacking the city with giant robots, hired thugs, and other super villains in order to be crowned king. Master Mind is a disembodied brain. The scenarios in this expansion are linked together and are meant to be played in a specific order. For example, if the heroes lose scenario one, they move on to scenario two. If the heroes win, they can skip to scenario three.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. The villain side has certain objectives (such as rob the bank and exit the board) and the heroes win if they prevent these objectives from happening.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Heroes Inc 6: Overmind's Invasion
Description:
Heroes Inc 6: Overmind’s Invasion is an expansion to Heroes Inc 1, 2, and 3. All three games are required to use this expansion. In this expansion, an alien villain named Overmind is invading the Earth and only two heroes (Firefly and Liberty Lass) are there to fight him. Overmind is an alien with a very large brain and over-sized head. The scenarios in this expansion are linked together and are meant to be played in a specific order. For example, if the heroes lose scenario one, they move on to scenario two. If the heroes win, they can skip to scenario three.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. The villain side has certain objectives (such as do a certain amount of damage to the city and exit the board) and the heroes win if they prevent these objectives from happening.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Heroes Inc 7: Mystic Pain
Description:
Heroes Inc 7: Mystic Pain is an expansion to Heroes Inc 1, 2, and 3. All three games are required to use this expansion. In this expansion, Master Mind is back and has teamed with a magical new villain named Mysterion to once again try and take over the world. A young heroin named Magic and the other heroes must stop them. The scenarios in this expansion are linked together and are meant to be played in a specific order. For example, if the heroes lose scenario one, they move on to scenario two. If the heroes win, they can skip to scenario three.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Heroes Inc 8
Description:
Heroes Inc 8 is an expansion to Heroes Inc. In this expansion, a new hero named Star Girl has just started using her powers to fight crime. A villain, named Storm Queen, from a distant planet has come to Earth to conquer the inhabitants. It's up to Star Girl and the other heroes to stop her.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Asteroid Racers
Description:
Asteroid Racers is a racing game in which players are racing space ships through an asteroid field. Players may attack their opponents during the race in order to slow them down. Before the race, players can build and customize their ship using a points system. Players have 35 points to spend on ship components. Each player has a playing mat that keeps track of all upgrades to the ship as well as damage received from the asteroids and other players. The game also includes an Asteroid deck of cards which players use to track race progress and events.

From the publisher:
Asteroid Racers is a fast game of resource management and card play. The goal for each player is to be the first to traverse the deadly asteroid belt, racing at brake neck speeds so that you can be the first to cross the finish line and be declared the newest Asteroid Race champion. Be careful though, not only do you have to deal with the dangers of the asteroid belt, but also the other racers, for they will be armed with deadly weapons and missiles, each trying to shoot you down before you can win the race.

Name: Dragon Ranchers
Description:
Dragon Ranchers is a card game in which players build a dragon using cards that feature the dragon's attack and defense capabilities as well as other statistics. There are several rules governing traits the dragon can possess, such as no more than 10 attack or defense cards.

The players each have a hand of five cards which they use to build the dragon. At the start of each turn, they will roll an activation die and can only use cards with a value equal to or less than that number. As the players build their dragons, cards that have been placed on the table are playable but only those with a value less than the activation number are active.

From the publisher:
Dragon Ranchers allows players to build a dragon deck made up of various cards. When both players have constructed a deck, they then battle each other, using attacks and defensive moves as they try to defeat their opponents.

Name: Space Assault
Description:
Space Assault is a fast-paced dexterity game set in deep space.  Players pilot a set of ships through a randomly created asteroid field, while trying to destroy their enemies using laser cannons and homing missiles.

Space Assault can be played one on one, in teams for large-scale conflicts or as a bloody free-for-all game.

Name: Deathfear
Description:
Deathfear is a board game in which each player takes the role of an adventurer trapped in a demon's tomb. The object of the game is to collect the parts of that demon and use them to eliminate the other players.

Movement is determined by dice rolling, and combat takes place by simply landing on a square occupied by an opponent.

The demon parts are represented by cards placed in four locations within the tomb. Each card grants unique abilities such as ranged attacks or teleportation. After six or more of these cards have been collected, the player may opt to transform into the demon for a limited time.  If that player eliminates all of their opponents within that time, they win the game... if not, they die.
